MUST: Must - This tag indicates that the specification is mandatory and enforced.
SHOULD: Should - This tag indicates that the specification is recommended but not strictly enforced.
MAY: May - This tag indicates that the specification is optional and can be skipped if not applicable.
Owner: Owner - This specification is relevant for module owner persona.
Contributor: Contributor - This specification is relevant for contributor persona, who does routine maintenance and updates tasks.
Initial: Initial - When creating a module, this specification is relevant.
BAU: Business as Usual - In regular operations, this tag indicates that the specification is relevant.
EOL: End of Life - The stage, when the module is being decommissioned .
Lifecycle-EOL: Lifecycle End of Life - This specification is relevant for the end of life phase of a module.
Manual: Manual - The specification is manually enforced at the time of the module review.
CI/Informational: CI/Informational - The the module is checked against the specification by a CI pipeline, but the failure is only informational and doesnâ€™t block the module release.
CI/Enforced: CI/Enforced - The the specification is automatically enforced by a CI pipeline, and the failure blocks the module release
